claimant.translation[0].definitions[0].d: someone who claims something, especially money, from the government, a court etc because they think they have a right to it
claimant.translation[1].definitions[0].d: someone who requests or receives money from the state because they are ill, unemployed etc
claimant.translation[1].definitions[1].d: someone who requests and receives money from an insurer for damage, theft, injury etc for which they are insured
claimant.translation[1].definitions[1].e: No payment will be made if the claimant, at the time of effecting the insurance, was receiving medical treatment.
claimant.translation[1].definitions[2].d: someone who demands money from a person or organization that has caused harm to them
claimant.translation[1].definitions[2].e: Claimants using a product while drunk will not receive damages.
claimant.translation[1].definitions[3].d: someone who states that they have a right to take or receive something that belongs to them
claimant.translation[1].definitions[3].e: a claimant to an interest in land
